snippet: Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio named as the next police commissioner William J. Bratton, who held the post in the 1990s and will return at a time of low crime and a deepening rift between officers and the public.
abstract: New York City Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio names William J Bratton as police commissioner; it will be Bratton's second stint in the seat, returning to a city much changed from the crime-ravaged he came to oversee in 1994; his is perhaps the single most important and visible appointment to be made by de Blasio, who was elected partially because of his criticism of the New York Police Department's aggressive use of stop-and-frisk tactics.

byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio named as the next police commissioner William J. Bratton, who held the post in the 1990s and will return at a time of low crime and a deepening rift between officers and the public.

headline.main: Bratton to Lead New York Police for Second Time
headline.print_headline: Bratton to Lead New York Police For Second Time
